description:
'''John Peter Farnham''' {{post-nominals|country=AUS|size=100%|AO}} (born 1 July 1949) is a British-born Australian singer. Farnham was a [[Teen idol|teen pop idol]] from 1967 until the mid-1970s, billed as '''Johnny Farnham'''. He has since forged a career as an [[Adult contemporary music|adult contemporary]] singer. His career has mostly been as a solo artist, although he replaced [[Glenn Shorrock]] as lead singer of [[Little River Band]] from 1982 to 1985.

In November 1986, his solo single "[[You're the Voice]]" peaked at No. 1 on the [[Kent Music Report|Australian singles charts]]. The associated album, ''[[Whispering Jack]]'', held the No. 1 position for a total of 25 weeks. Both the single and the album had top-ten success internationally, including No. 6 in the United Kingdom and No. 1 in Sweden. ''Whispering Jack'' is the [[List of best-selling albums in Australia|third-highest-selling album in Australian history]], and {{as of |May 2023|lc=yes}} remains the highest-selling album in Australia by an Australian act.

Farnham has become one of his country's best-known and most popular performers, and he is the only Australian artist to have a number-one record (album or single) in five consecutive decades (echoing that of [[Cliff Richard]] in the UK), with singles including "[[Sadie (The Cleaning Lady)]]" in 1967, "[[Raindrops Keep Fallin' on My Head]]" in 1970, and "[[Age of Reason (song)|Age of Reason]]" in 1988; and albums ''[[Whispering Jack]]'' in 1986, ''[[Age of Reason (album)|Age of Reason]]'' in 1988, ''[[Chain Reaction (John Farnham album)|Chain Reaction]]'' in 1990, ''[[Then Again (John Farnham album)|Then Again...]]'' in 1993, ''[[33⅓ (album)|33⅓]]'' in 2000, and ''[[The Last Time (album)|The Last Time]]'' in 2002. Along with touring with numerous artists, including [[The Seekers]] and international acts like [[Stevie Nicks]] and [[Lionel Richie]], he released various collaborative albums: [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]] on ''[[John Farnham & Tom Jones – Together in Concert|Together in Concert]]'' (2005); [[Olivia Newton-John]] and [[Anthony Warlow]], including ''[[Highlights from The Main Event]]'' (1998); ''[[Two Strong Hearts Live]]'' (2015); and ''[[Friends for Christmas]]'' (2016).

Farnham has been recognised by many honours and awards, including 1987 [[Australian of the Year]], 1996 Officer of the Order of Australia, and 19 [[ARIA Awards]], including his 2003 induction into the [[ARIA Hall of Fame|Hall of Fame]]. Starting in 1969, he was voted by ''[[TV Week]]'' readers as the '[[Australian pop music awards#1967–1978: King of Pop Awards|King of Pop]]' for five consecutive years.

Aside from his recording career, Farnham performed on stage with lead roles in Australian productions of ''[[Charlie Girl]]'', ''[[Pippin (musical)|Pippin]]'' and 1992's ''[[Jesus Christ Superstar]]''. He starred in his own TV series and specials, including ''It's Magic'' (With [[Colleen Hewett]]), ''[[Bobby Dazzler]]'', and Farnham and Byrne (with [[Debra Byrne]]), and as a guest on numerous other popular shows such as ''[[The Don Lane Show]]'', ''[[Countdown (Australian TV series)|Countdown]]'' and ''[[Hey Hey It's Saturday]]''.
